As they fly toward the Ark,Tucson is closely monitored by Rat Trap as well =
as Quickstride who is now looking for ways to speed up the re energization =
process for the Autobot's system.  He scratches behind an ear as if puzzled=
 by what to do next.

" Hmm... He's not re energizing as fast as I'd hoped =
he would... I must've missed something Lord Elder, but I'll be slagged if I=
 know what it is."

Rat Trap looks at Tucson's gauge.

" Well, he's at fort=
y two percent now, on his regular supply of energy and he's gettn' a consta=
nt flow of energon with the energon power port.  But unless we get 'em inta=
 robot mode, it's gonna take a lot longer ta get it in 'em while he's in th=
is form."

Tucson sighs.

" I - promise Lord Elder.  Not one thing - will b=
e touched in the ark.  In honor of those I serve, I will - not upset any ba=
lance that still remains in place."  

Rat Trap taps on Tucson's hood.

"Wh=
eels, sorry ta bother ya but, think you can transform for us?  The energon =
port will be able ta reach your system a lot faster if we can put a direct =
line inta one of your arm or leg ports, for proper circulation."

Tucson is=
 released from the saftey harness put on by Quickstride, as he and Rat Trap=
 stand back to give him room to transform.  Slowly the Autobot manages to g=
et into robot mode, and the port locations are switched to an arm port on h=
is right forearm.  He points to it.

"Thanks Wheels."

Tucson chuckles.  He=
 was growing fond of his new nick name.

"Wheels. I could get used to that.=
  As a matter of fact, when I'm in vehicle form, that's what brings up my c=
hasse off the ground quite a bit.  I could've chosen that name, would've fi=
t me."

Rat Trap now looks at him with an honest face.

"Actually, there is=
 a name that fits ya better.  What'dya think about TUCSON PRIME?"

Quickstr=
ide gives Rat Trap a thumbs up.

" Works for me, what'dya think Lord Elder?=
"

As they discussed what name fit him best, Tucson is taken aback by the n=
ame Rat Trap blirts out.  He thinks to himself.

"Tucson Prime...  That's v=
ery nice of them to think of me that way, but I don't think I could ever fi=
t in the boots of a Prime.  What Prime leads a group of Autobots when he hi=
mself can not see two inches in front of his face?   Optimus if you're watc=
hing over me, I could really use your insight right about now.  Well, anywa=
y, I suppose that'll have to wait until I reach the Ark.  I sure hope you c=
an spare some time to talk because I really need to talk to you."

Rat Trap=
 sees Tucson's expression.

"Wheels? What's wrong?  Ya look kinda worried."=


Tucson couldn't hide it, he did not know which road to take and even thou=
gh he was strong, he felt absolutely helpless spiritually.  Without Optimus=
 Prime to talk to, he did not know where to turn for help.  Yet, Lord Elder=
 and the other Maximals proved to be the greatest of friends to him, and he=
 felt he could open up to them.  He sits up against the wall of the ship, a=
nd puts a hand on Rat Trap and Quickstride's shoulders.

" Ever go down a r=
oad, not knowing where it leads, and finding yourself more lost than ever? =
 That's where I feel I am right now.  Somewhere I took a wrong turn, and I =
don't know my way back."

Rat Trap adjusts the feed of energon into Tucson'=
s arm port.

" I sure know that one Wheels.  Primus knows we've all been th=
ere in some point in our lives.  But I got a feeln' that I don't normally g=
et..  I ain't usually too optimistic but there's a tiny little feeling of o=
ptimism startn' ta build in me.  Don't usually get this warm'n fuzzy but it=
's there.  And it started when I first saw ya in that fortress.  I think yo=
u got lucky for a reason Wheels, you got lucky because it was fate.  Yep th=
at's what it was, fate.  And from what I kinda know about Roddimus... "Grim=
e"...  He wasn't too ready ta take on the responsibility of ben' a Prime of=
ficer, it just somehow happened.  But you, on the other hand, you got what =
it takes. I think you might just be a lost Prime, if ya ask me."

Tucson hi=
ccups for a moment.

"Well, I dunno..  It's a very nice thought but, me?  A=
 Prime?  I'm not so sure..."

Rat Trap smirks.

"Hmph, let's see what Lord =
Elder thinks.  Sir, what'dya think?  Could Wheels be the next Autobot leade=
r?"

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wro=
te:
>
> (OOC: Hope you don't mind I changed the subject/thread)
> 
> > Tucs=
on backs up and tries to face Lord Elder.
> >
> > " I owe Lord Elder my utm=
ost gratitude. If - you had not guarded the - Ark, all would - have been lo=
st. I - thank you deeply for your
> > loyalty, and - constant vigil over th=
e Autobot vessel. Once I - figure out how to revive my comrades, I - will b=
e sure they know of your valliant efforts to - protect what is most preciou=
s to us. R - Rat Tap. You too, have - shown bravery in your actions. I owe =
you as much, if not more of my loyalty to you. without - your help, I would=
 not have gotten out of that fortress."
> 
> Lord elder looked almost embar=
rassed as Tuscon thanked him. "I only
> did what any Maximal would do for a=
 comrade in arms." he said, a small
> smile appearing on his face. "But bef=
ore you thank me, let's get you
> home first."
> 
> With a burst of power f=
rom the engines, flames burst from the VTOL
> boosters and and lifted them =
off the ground. As they rose the shuttle
> shook as the craft complained ab=
out damage from the rather rough
> landing. However the shuttle quickly lev=
eled out as Lord Elder turned
> the ship and put them on course back toward=
s the Ark.
> 
> > "Not - at all. Lord Elder, I - have one favor to ask you.=
 I'd - like to pay my respects to Optimus - Prime once we arrive at the Ark=
. Do - I have permission to enter the Ark to do so?"
> 
> "Of course Tuscon=
, we will all be entering the Ark." Elder said from
> his seat, his voice s=
omewhat distracted, "But make sure that you don't
> disturb anything. It is=
 very important that we leave everything as we
> find it."
> 
> The shuttle=
 rumbled a bit as the engines sputtered and ignited again,
> "That is if we=
 make it back."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
> (Lord Elder)
